meanings.def: to provide somebody with the money that they need in order to do something
examples: A bank loan helped to set him up in business.

meanings.def: to make somebody healthier, stronger, more lively, etc.
examples: The break from work really set me up for the new year.

meanings.def: to trick somebody, especially by making them appear guilty of something
examples: He denied the charges, saying the police had set him up.

meanings.def: to create something or start it
examples: A fund will be set up for the dead men's families.

meanings.def: to build something or put something somewhere
examples: The police set up roadblocks on routes out of the city.

meanings.def: to make a piece of equipment or a machine ready for use
examples: She set up her guitar and amp in her bedroom.

meanings.def: to arrange for something to happen
examples: I've set up a meeting for Friday.

meanings.def: to start a process or a series of events
examples: The slump on Wall Street set up a chain reaction in stock markets around the world.
She took out a bank loan and set up on her own.
After leaving college, he set himself up as a freelance photographer.

meanings.def: a way of organizing something; a system
examples: I've only been here a couple of weeks and I don't really know the set-up.
What’s the set-up in your family—who does the cooking?

meanings.def: a situation in which somebody tricks you or makes it seem as if you have done something wrong
examples: He didn't steal the goods. It was a set-up.
